title: How to Draw Ducks

steps.headline: Draw a small circle for the head and a big oblong below it for the body.
Connect the head to the body using curved strokes.
steps.description: Draw the tail using slanted lines that form into pointed angles.

steps.headline: Add the beak using small straight stokes and the feet using sticks.
steps.description: Draw a triangle for the feet.

steps.headline: Add a small circular shape for the eyes and refine the details of the beak.
Draw the head and the neck based on your outline.
Draw the duck's body and legs.
Draw the feet.
steps.description: The duck’s digits are webbed, take note of this detail in your drawing.

steps.headline: Draw a circle and a large oblong below it.
Connect the circle to the oblong using curved lines.
steps.description: Add a pointy curve on the rear part of the oblong for the tail.

steps.headline: Add a small circle inside the big one for the eyes.
steps.description: Sketch the beak in front of where the eyes are drawn. Draw a slanted egg-shape inside the big oblong for the duck’s wings.

steps.headline: Refine details of the eyes and beak.
steps.description: Draw the pupils using an oblong shading half of it in black leaving a small part white.

steps.headline: Draw the whole head and the neck using your outline as guide.
Stretch the drawing to the duck's body and tail.
steps.description: Add curved lines on the wing for the feathers.

steps.headline: Refine the drawing and erase unnecessary lines.

text: A Simple Duck Draw a small circle for the head and a big oblong below it for the body.  Connect the head to the body using curved strokes. Draw the tail using slanted lines that form into pointed angles. Add the beak using small straight stokes and the feet using sticks. Draw a triangle for the feet. Add a small circular shape for the eyes and refine the details of the beak.  Draw the head and the neck based on your outline.  Draw the duck's body and legs.  Draw the feet. The duck’s digits are webbed, take note of this detail in your drawing. Erase unnecessary lines.  Color the drawing if desired.  A Rubber Duck Draw a circle and a large oblong below it.  Connect the circle to the oblong using curved lines. Add a pointy curve on the rear part of the oblong for the tail. Add a small circle inside the big one for the eyes. Sketch the beak in front of where the eyes are drawn. Draw a slanted egg-shape inside the big oblong for the duck’s wings. Refine details of the eyes and beak. Draw the pupils using an oblong shading half of it in black leaving a small part white. Draw the whole head and the neck using your outline as guide.  Stretch the drawing to the duck's body and tail. Add curved lines on the wing for the feathers. Refine the drawing and erase unnecessary lines.  Color the drawing.
